item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, May 20, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
item.description:
1. DDoSecrets publishes 410 GB of heap dumps, hacked from TeleMessage (325 points | 76 comments)
2. The Windows Subsystem for Linux is now open source (1232 points | 796 comments)
3. I got fooled by AI-for-science hype–here's what it taught me (28 points | 4 comments)
4. Have I Been Pwned 2.0 (466 points | 143 comments)
5. What are people doing? Live-ish estimates based on global population dynamics (101 points | 28 comments)
6. Jules: An Asynchronous Coding Agent (290 points | 118 comments)
7. A shower thought turned into a Collatz visualization (88 points | 14 comments)
8. Zod 4 (649 points | 193 comments)
9. GitHub Copilot Coding Agent (397 points | 232 comments)
10. Ann, the Small Annotation Server (16 points | 2 comments)
11. Claude Code SDK (320 points | 145 comments)
12. Launch HN: Better Auth (YC X25) – Authentication Framework for TypeScript (203 points | 80 comments)
13. Show HN: A free, privacy preserving, archive of public Discord servers (34 points | 26 comments)
14. Run GitHub Actions locally (210 points | 85 comments)
15. Kilo: A text editor in less than 1000 LOC with syntax highlight and search (113 points | 14 comments)
16. A man who visited every country in the world without boarding a plane (2023) (34 points | 9 comments)
17. Game theory illustrated by an animated cartoon game (256 points | 43 comments)
18. The forbidden railway: Vienna-Pyongyang (2008) (167 points | 45 comments)
19. Memory Consistency Models: A Tutorial (30 points | 2 comments)
20. Terraform MCP Server (62 points | 11 comments)
21. Remarks on AI from NZ (146 points | 73 comments)
22. xAI's Grok 3 comes to Microsoft Azure (122 points | 108 comments)
23. WireGuard vanity keygen (74 points | 11 comments)
24. Too Much Go Misdirection (161 points | 77 comments)
25. Solving the local optima problem – NQueens (5 points | 1 comment)
26. Patience too cheap to meter (33 points | 12 comments)
27. Experimentation Matters: Why Nuenki isn't using pairwise evaluations (3 points | discuss)
28. Biff – a batteries-included web framework for Clojure (19 points | 1 comment)
29. Dilbert creator Scott Adams says he will die soon from same cancer as Joe Biden (342 points | 383 comments)
30. Self-Hosting Moose with Docker Compose, Redis, Temporal, Redpanda and ClickHouse (37 points | 9 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, May 20, 2025 at 6:25 AM UTC
